item.title: Valisa add a quote by Slavoj Zizek
item.description: "The one measure of true love is: you can insult the other" -- Slavoj Zizek

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "The first thing I learned at school was that some people are idiots; the second thing I learned was that some are even worse. " -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Valisa add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "Being rich is not about how much money you have or how many homes you own; it's the freedom to buy any book you want without looking at the price and wondering if you can afford it." -- John Waters

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "He feared me as many men fear women: because their mistresses (or their wives) understand them. They are scarcely adult, some men: they wish women to understand them, and to that end they tell them all their secrets; and then, when they are properly understood, they hate their women for understanding them." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "The writer must be universal in sympathy and an outcast by nature: only then can he see clearly." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "Life … is a bit like reading. … If all your responses to a book have already been duplicated and expanded upon by a professional critic, then what point is there to your reading? Only that it’s yours. Similarly, why live your life? Because it’s yours. But what if such an answer becomes less and less convincing?" -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Juan Carlos Onetti
item.description: "I applaud the courage of he who accepts each and every one of the laws of a game he did not invent and was not asked if he wanted to play" -- Juan Carlos Onetti

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Roberto Bolano
item.description: "Books are finite, sexual encounters are finite, but the desire to read and to fuck is infinite; it surpasses our own deaths, our fears, our hopes for peace." -- Roberto Bolano

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Roberto Bolaño
item.description: "Nothing good ever comes of love. What comes of love is always something better" -- Roberto Bolaño

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Bohumil Hrabal
item.description: "My education has been so unwitting I can't quite tell which of my thoughts come from me and which from my books, but that's how I've stayed attuned to myself and the world around me for the past thirty-five years. Because when I read, I don't really read; I pop a beautiful sentence into my mouth and suck it like a fruit drop, or I sip it like a liqueur until the thought dissolves in me like alcohol, infusing brain and heart and coursing on through the veins to the root of each blood vessel." -- Bohumil Hrabal

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Bohumil Hrabal
item.description: "And so everything I see in this world, it all moves backward and forward at the same time, like a black-smith's bellows, like everything in my press, turning into its opposite at the command of the red and green buttons, and that's what makes the world go round." -- Bohumil Hrabal

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free." -- Rumi

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Roland Barthes
item.description: "Language is a skin: I rub my language against the other. It is as if I had words instead of fingers, or fingers at the tip of my words. My language trembles with desire." -- Roland Barthes

item.title: Valisa add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.." -- John Milton

item.title: Valisa add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "Solitude sometimes is best society." -- John Milton

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "What should I do about the wild and the tame? The wild heart that wants to be free, and the tame heart that wants to come home. I want to be held. I don't want you to come too close. I want you to scoop me up and bring me home at nights. I don't want to tell you where I am. I want to keep a place among the rocks where no one can find me. I want to be with you." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "The real hero is always a hero by mistake; he dreams of being an honest coward like everybody else." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "I love the smell of book ink in the morning." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means..." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Is it possible, in the final analysis, for one human being to achieve perfect understanding of another? We can invest enormous time and energy in serious efforts to know another person, but in the end, how close can we come to that person's essence? We convince ourselves that we know the other person well, but do we really know anything important about anyone?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "The story is not in the words; it's in the struggle." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Antonio Tabucchi
item.description: "personally I don't trust literature that soothes people's consciences." -- Antonio Tabucchi

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "Reading a book is like re-writing it for yourself. You bring to a novel, anything you read, all your experience of the world. You bring your history and you read it in your own terms." -- Angela Carter

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Remembrance of things past is not necessarily the remembrance of things as they were." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Cioran
item.description: "A book is a suicide postponed." -- Cioran

item.title: Valisa add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "But when the strong were too weak to hurt the weak, the weak had to be strong enough to leave." -- Milan Kundera
